text:
Hi,



I designed a small site using cgi scripts and there I have an upload page. The problem is that I got the message(in browser) "document contained no data" when I tried to upload a big file(500Mb). With small files I got no error. The browser I used is Netscape 4.79. I tried with IE and the upload worked fine for both small and big files.

I put error_log to debug level and I got following info:

[Tue Mar  4 10:22:15 2003] [info] [client 207.33.129.85] read script header timed out



I don't kmnow if this error comes form Apache but maybe you can help me with some ideas.



Thank you,

Calin
creator: trcalin@yahoo.com
satch@satchell.net
text:
In working with file upload, I experimented with both Apache 1.3 and Apache 2.0
with a wide variety of file length.  What I found using Opera is that the magic
error length is around 7.5 megabytes.  Anything smaller than that and everything
works great.  Larger than that and I get...varied results.  Interestingly,
ulimit -a shows that the stack size limit is set to 8192 KB -- like whatever is
storing the file data is doing it in the stack.  (It's a place to start
looking.)  I did try to change the maximum stack size with an /etc/initscript
(Linux) that sets a stack limit of 20,000 KB, but that didn't change anything.

creator: satch@satchell.net
text:
My prior comment is based on work with Red Hat 7.3 and Red Hat 9.0 (Apache
1.3.23 and 2.0.40) on Intel iron, not Sun.  Linux kernel 2.4.18 and 2.4.20.  The
browsers are Opera 7.10, Mozilla 1.3, IE 5.50 SP2.

creator: satch@satchell.net
text:
Oh, never mind.  <sigh>  I found a software conflict on my client computer that
was causing the upload to fail.  See bug 17459, though, for the interesting
limit condition I found there.

Apologies for the false alarm.

creator: trcalin@yahoo.com
text:
Hi,

Thank you for your answer.
My webserver is a Sun machine with SunOS 5.7 and Apache 1.3.27 (Unix).
I tried to use my scripts on a Linux webserver and I have no problem to upload
big and small files with all the browser types. I have the upload problems only
on Sun webserver.

Regards,
Calin Turcan
